00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.out~
00003  * External for Jamoma: manage audio outputs for a module
00004  * By Tim Place, Copyright © 2006
00005  * 
00006  * License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00007  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html 
00008  */
00009 
00010 
00011 /*
00012         The user specifies @channel_config mono or @channel_config stereo 
00013         as arg to the module.  That makes the hub responsible for cleaning
00014         up an unused inlets and outlets for the configuration.  
00015         
00016         It may also signal to the module to handle the poly differently,
00017         i.e. if the algorithm should be true stereo instead of multi-mono
00018         
00019         This all means that we need this object to subscribe to the hub.
00020 */
00021 
00022 
00023 #include "Jamoma.h"
00024 #include "jcom.out.h"
00025 
00026 #define POLL_INTERVAL   150                     // metro time
00027 
00028 // Globals
00029 t_class         *out_class;                                     // Required. Global pointing to this class
00030 
00031 
00032 /************************************************************************************/
00033 // Main() Function
00034 
00035 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00036 {
00037         long            attrflags = 0;
00038         t_class         *c;
00039         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00040         long            offset;
00041         
00042         jamoma_init();
00043 
00044         // Define our class
00045 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00046         c = class_new("jcom.out~",(method)out_new, (method)out_free, (short)sizeof(t_out), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00047 #else
00048         c = class_new("jcom.out",(method)out_new, (method)out_free, (short)sizeof(t_out), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00049 #endif
00050 
00051         offset = calcoffset(t_out, common);
00052         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00053 
00054         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_dispatched,                      "dispatched",                   A_GIMME, 0L);
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_algorithm_message,       "algorithm_message",    A_GIMME, 0L);
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_link_to_in_object,       "link_in",                              A_CANT, 0L);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_unlink,                          "unlink_in",                    0L);
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_register_meter,          "register_meter",               A_CANT, 0L);
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_remove_meters,           "remove_meters",                A_CANT, 0L);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_register_preview,        "register_preview",             A_CANT, 0L);
00062 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_getAudioForChannel,      "getAudioForChannel",   A_CANT, 0);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_dsp,                                     "dsp",                                  A_CANT, 0L);
00065 #else
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_anything,                        "anything",                             A_GIMME, 0L);
00067         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_sendbypassedvalue,       "sendbypassedvalue",    A_CANT, 0L);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_sendlastvalue,           "sendlastvalue",                A_CANT, 0L);
00069 #endif
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_release,                         "release",                              A_CANT, 0L);    // notification of hub being freed
00071     class_addmethod(c, (method)out_assist,                              "assist",                               A_CANT, 0L);
00072 
00073         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset); 
00074         
00075         // ATTRIBUTE: algorithm_type
00076         attr = attr_offset_new("algorithm_type", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00077                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_out, attr_algorithm_type));
00078         class_addattr(c, attr);
00079         
00080         // ATTRIBUTE: num_inputs
00081         attr = attr_offset_new("num_outputs", _sym_long, attrflags,
00082                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_out, num_outputs));
00083         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00084 
00085 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00086         // Setup our class to work with MSP
00087         class_dspinit(c);
00088 #endif 
00089 
00090         // Finalize our class
00091         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00092         out_class = c;
00093         return 0;
00094 }

00097 /************************************************************************************/
00098 // Object Life
00099 
00100 // Create
00101 void *out_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00102 {
00103         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00104         t_out           *x = (t_out *)object_alloc(out_class);
00105         short           i;
00106 
00107         if(x){
00108                 x->dumpout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00109                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)x->dumpout);         // setup the dumpout
00110 
00111                 x->num_outputs =  1;
00112                 x->vector_size = 0;
00113                 x->attr_preview = 0;
00114                 x->preview_object = NULL;
00115                 x->attr_bypass = 0;
00116                 x->attr_mute = 0;
00117                 x->attr_algorithm_type = _sym_nothing;
00118                 if(attrstart > 0){
00119                         int argument = atom_getlong(argv);
00120                         x->num_outputs = tt_audio_base::clip(argument, 0, MAX_NUM_CHANNELS);
00121                 }
00122 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00123                 if(x->num_outputs > 0)
00124                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, x->num_outputs);             // Create Object and Inlets
00125                 else
00126                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, 1);                                  // Create Object and Inlets
00127                         
00128                 x->common.ob.z_misc = Z_NO_INPLACE | Z_PUT_LAST;        // Z_PUT_LAST so that thispoly~ gets it's message properly?             
00129                 for(i=0; i < (x->num_outputs); i++)
00130                         outlet_new((t_pxobject *)x, "signal");                  // Create a signal Outlet               
00131 
00132                 x->clock = clock_new(x, (method)update_meters);
00133                 x->clock_is_set = 0;
00134                 x->signal_in = new tt_audio_signal;
00135                 x->signal_out = new tt_audio_signal;
00136                 x->signal_temp = new tt_audio_signal;
00137                 x->xfade = new tt_crossfade;
00138                 x->copy = new tt_copy;
00139                 x->gain = new tt_gain;
00140                 x->ramp_gain = new tt_ramp;
00141                 x->ramp_xfade = new tt_ramp;
00142                 out_alloc(x, sys_getblksize());                                         // allocates the vectors for the audio signals
00143 #else
00144                 for(i=x->num_outputs-1; i >= 1; i--)
00145                         x->inlet[i] = proxy_new(x, i, 0L);
00146                 for(i=x->num_outputs-1; i >= 0; i--)
00147                         x->outlet[i] = outlet_new(x, 0L);
00148 #endif          
00149                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(&x->common, ps__jcom_out__, ps_subscribe_out);
00150                 jcom_core_subscriber_setcustomsubscribe_method(&x->common, &out_subscribe);
00151                 
00152                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00153                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00154         }
00155         return (x);                                                                                             // Return the pointer
00156 }

00159 // deferred function for registering with the jcom.hub object
00160 void out_subscribe(void *z)
00161 {
00162         long            argc;
00163         t_atom          a;
00164         t_atom          *argv = &a;
00165         t_symbol        *result;
00166         t_symbol        *modtype;
00167         t_out           *x = (t_out *)z;
00168         
00169         //x->common.hub = jcom_core_subscribe(x, x->common.attr_name, x->common.container, ps_subscribe_out);
00170         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00171                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_name, &argc, &argv);
00172                 x->common.module_name = atom_getsym(argv);
00173                 x->num_meter_objects = 0;
00174                 
00175                 // Find out what type of algorithm this is supposed to control
00176                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_algorithm_type, &argc, &argv);
00177                 result = atom_getsym(argv);
00178                 if(result == ps_default){
00179                         object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_module_type, &argc, &argv);
00180                         modtype = atom_getsym(argv);
00181                 
00182                         if(modtype == ps_audio)
00183                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_poly;
00184                         else if(modtype == ps_video)
00185                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_jitter;
00186                         else
00187                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_control;
00188                 }
00189                 else
00190                         x->attr_algorithm_type = result;
00191         }
00192 }

00195 // Destroy
00196 void out_free(t_out *x)
00197 {
00198 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00199         dsp_free((t_pxobject *)x);                      // Always call dsp_free first in this routine
00200         freeobject((t_object *)x->clock);       // delete our clock
00201         
00202         delete x->signal_in;
00203         delete x->signal_out;
00204         delete x->signal_temp;
00205         delete x->xfade;
00206         delete x->copy;
00207         delete x->gain;
00208         delete x->ramp_gain;
00209         delete x->ramp_xfade;
00210 #endif
00211         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free(&x->common);
00212 }
00213 
00214 
00215 // Notification that the hub no longer exists
00216 void out_release(t_out *x)
00217 {
00218         short i;
00219         
00220         jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease(&x->common);    
00221         x->in_object = NULL;
00222         for(i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00223                 x->meter_object[i] = NULL;
00224         x->num_meter_objects = 0;
00225         x->preview_object = NULL;
00226 }

00229 /************************************************************************************/
00230 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00231 
00232 // Method for Assistance Messages
00233 void out_assist(t_out *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00234 {
00235         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00236                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) connect to the module algorithm");
00237         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00238                 if(arg < x->num_outputs) strcpy(dst, "(signal) connect to the module's outlets");
00239                 else strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00240         }
00241 }

00243 
00244 // messages received from jcom.hub for the algorithm
00245 void out_algorithm_message(t_out *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00246 {
00247         if(argc < 2)
00248                 return;
00249                 
00250         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00251                 if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_gain_midi) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_gain_midi)){
00252                         // Do gain control here...
00253                         // Should be that the gain change triggers a short tt_ramp to the new value
00254                         x->attr_gain = atom_getfloat(argv+1);   // store as midi values
00255                         x->gain->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain, (x->attr_gain - 127) * .6);          // convert midi to db for tap_gain                      
00256                 }
00257                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_mute) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_mute)){
00258                         x->attr_mute = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00259                         if(x->attr_mute)
00260                                 x->gain->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain_direct, 0.);
00261                         else 
00262                                 x->gain->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain, (x->attr_gain - 127)  * .6);                 
00263                 }
00264                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_bypass) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_bypass)){
00265                         x->attr_bypass = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00266                         if(x->attr_bypass == 0)
00267                                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, x->attr_mix * 0.01);
00268                         else
00269                                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, 0.0);
00270                 }
00271                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_mix) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_mix)){
00272                         x->attr_mix = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00273                         if(x->attr_bypass == 0)
00274                                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, x->attr_mix * 0.01);                       
00275                 }
00276                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_sample_rate) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_sample_rate)){
00277                         ;
00278                 }
00279                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_meters_freeze) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_meters_freeze)){
00280                         x->attr_defeat_meters = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00281                 }
00282                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_preview) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_preview))
00283                         x->attr_preview = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00284         }
00285 }

00299 void out_register_meter(t_out *x, int meternum, void *meter_object)
00300 {
00301         x->meter_object[meternum] = meter_object;
00302         if((meternum+1) > x->num_meter_objects)
00303                 x->num_meter_objects = meternum+1;
00304 }

00307 void out_remove_meters(t_out *x)
00308 {
00309         short i;
00310         for(i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00311                 x->meter_object[i] = NULL;
00312         x->num_meter_objects = 0;
00313 }

00329 // messages received from jcom.in
00330 void out_sendbypassedvalue(t_out *x, short inletnum, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00331 {
00332         if(inletnum < x->num_outputs)
00333                 outlet_anything(x->outlet[inletnum], msg, argc, argv);
00334 }

00336 
00337 void out_sendlastvalue(t_out *x)
00338 {
00339         // we need to cache the most recently sent values for this to work...
00340         // in the case of jitter, i guess we need to cache a *copy* of a Jitter matrix
00341         // ick
00342         // or maybe we just send the matrix name as passed in from this out objects inlets
00343         // because it shouldn't have changed since input to the algorithm is turned off...
00344         short i;
00345 
00346         for(i=0; i< x->num_outputs; i++)
00347                 outlet_anything(x->outlet[i], x->last_msg[i], x->last_argc[i], x->last_argv[i]);
00348 }
00349 
00350 
00351 void out_anything(t_out *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00352 {
00353         short inletnum = proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x);
00354         x->last_msg[inletnum] = msg;
00355         x->last_argc[inletnum] = argc;
00356         sysmem_copyptr(argv, x->last_argv[inletnum], argc * sizeof(t_atom));
00357         
00358         if(x->attr_preview == 1){
00359                 if(msg == _sym_jit_matrix){
00360                         object_method_typed(x->preview_object, _sym_jit_matrix, argc, argv, NULL);
00361                 }
00362         }
00363         outlet_anything(x->outlet[inletnum], msg, argc, argv);
00364 }
00365 
00366 
00367 void update_meters(t_out *x)
00368 {
00369         short   i;
00370         t_atom  a[2];
00371         
00372         for(i=0; i < x->num_meter_objects; i++){
00373                 if(x->meter_object[i]){
00374                         atom_setsym(&a[0], _sym_float);
00375                         atom_setfloat(&a[1], x->peakamp[i]);
00376                         object_method_typed(x->meter_object[i], ps_dispatched, 2, a, NULL);
00377                 }
00378         }
00379         x->clock_is_set = 0;
00380 }
00381 
00382 
00383 // Perform Method - just pass the whole vector straight through
00384 // (the work is all done in the dsp method)
00385 t_int *out_perform(t_int *w)
00386 {
00387         t_out           *x              = (t_out *)(w[1]);                      // Object Struct
00388         short           i               = (short)(w[2]);                        // Channel Number (zero-based)
00389         short           n               = (int)(w[5]);
00390         float           *sig    = (t_float *)(w[4]);
00391         float           currentvalue = 0, peakvalue = 0;        // values for calculating metering
00392         x->signal_in->set_vector((t_float *)(w[3]));    // Input Wet
00393         x->signal_out->set_vector(sig);                                 // Output
00394         x->signal_in->set_vectorsize(n);                                // Vector Size
00395 
00396         if(x->attr_bypass){
00397                 while(n--)
00398                         *sig++ = *(x->in_object->signal_in[i]->vector++);
00399                 x->in_object->signal_in[i]->reset();    
00400                 goto out;
00401         }
00402         
00403         if(x->attr_mute){
00404                 while(n--)
00405                         *sig++ = 0;
00406                 goto out;
00407         }
00408 
00409         if(x->in_object && x->in_object->signal_in[i]->vector)
00410                 x->xfade->dsp_vector_calc(x->in_object->signal_in[i], x->signal_in, x->signal_temp);    // perform bypass/mix control
00411         else
00412                 x->copy->dsp_vector_calc(x->signal_in, x->signal_temp);
00413         x->gain->dsp_vector_calc(x->signal_temp, x->signal_out);                                                                // perform gain control
00414 
00415         if(x->attr_defeat_meters == 0){
00416                 while(n--){
00417                         currentvalue = ((*sig) < 0)?-(*sig):*sig; // get the current sample's absolute value
00418                         if(currentvalue > peakvalue)                                    // if it's a new peak amplitude...
00419                                 peakvalue = currentvalue;
00420                         sig++;                                                                          // increment pointer in the vector
00421                 }
00422                 if(peakvalue != x->peakamp[i]){                                 // filter out repetitions
00423                         x->peakamp[i] = peakvalue;
00424                         if(x->clock_is_set == 0){
00425                                 clock_delay(x->clock, POLL_INTERVAL);           // start the clock
00426                                 x->clock_is_set = 1;
00427                         }
00428                 }
00429         }
00430 out:
00431         return(w+6);
00432 }
00433 
00434 
00435 t_int *out_perform_zero(t_int *w)
00436 {
00437         t_float *out    = (t_float *)(w[1]);    // Output
00438         long    n               = (long)(w[2]);                 // vectorsize
00439 
00440         while(n--)
00441                 *out++ = 0;
00442         return(w+3);
00443 }

00446 void out_getAudioForChannel(t_out *x, int channel, float **vector)
00447 {
00448         *vector = x->out_vectors[channel];
00449 }

00451 
00452 // DSP Method
00453 void out_dsp(t_out *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00454 {
00455         short   i;
00456         int     vs = sp[0]->s_n;                        // Vector Size
00457         int             sr = sp[0]->s_sr;                       // Sample Rate  
00458 
00459         x->ramp_gain->set_sr(sr);
00460         x->ramp_xfade->set_sr(sr);
00461         out_alloc(x, vs);
00462 
00463         for(i=0; i < x->num_outputs; i++){                      // take a look at each
00464                 x->out_vectors[i] = sp[i]->s_vec;
00465                 if(count[i])
00466                         dsp_add(out_perform, 5, x, i, sp[i]->s_vec, sp[x->num_outputs + i]->s_vec, sp[i]->s_n);
00467                 else
00468                         dsp_add(out_perform_zero, 2, sp[x->num_outputs + i]->s_vec, sp[i]->s_n);
00469         }
00470 }
00471 
00472 
00473 void out_alloc(t_out *x, int vector_size)
00474 {
00475         if(vector_size != x->vector_size){
00476                 x->vector_size = vector_size;
00477                 x->signal_temp->alloc(vector_size);             
00478                 x->ramp_gain->set_vectorsize(vector_size);
00479                 x->ramp_xfade->set_vectorsize(vector_size);
00480         }
00481 }
